function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Modular construction for emergency hospitals may not have effective pathogen control measures in place, leading to increased transmission of and antimicrobial surfaces for hospital infrastructure.","People":"COVID-19 patients, healthcare workers, and visitors to emergency hospitals.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, architects, and construction companies."},{"Description":"Increased use of touchless technology and automation may lead to overreliance on these systems and neglect of manual cleaning and disinfection processes, processes.","Mitigation":"Combine touchless technology with regular manual cleaning and disinfection processes to ensure comprehensive pathogen control.","Technologies":"Artificial intelligence, touchless sensors, automated cleaning systems, and disinfection robots.","People":"Building occupants, employees, and visitors.","Owner":"Building management, facility maintenance teams, and technology providers."},{"Description":"High reliance on contactless systems may lead to a false sense of security and neglect of other important infection control measures, contributing to increased education on infection control measures, including the importance of ventilation, hand hygiene, and personal protective equipment.","Technologies":"Education and training programs, remote temperature control programs, and contactless systems for infection control.","People":"Building occupants, facility management, and cleaning staff.","Owner":"Building management, public health authorities, and
